Class ec.trace.StackFrameData 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.trace.StackFrameData
public class StackFrameData
extends Object
This class decomposes the Nth stack frame above it and provides accessors to useful information.

DANGER: it is HIGHLY dependent on the particular way the implementation prints stack traces. It should probably do some syntax checking.

For reference, here's the current print format: 

 java.lang.Exception
  at Trace.$(Trace.java:217)
  at Test.go(Test.java:25)
  at Test.main(Test.java:20)

Stack frames from jit-ed code look like: at Trace.$(Compiled Code)

className
The name of the class that method belongs to.
fileName
The file that method is in.
lineNumber
The line number the trace call is on.
methodName
The name of the method running in the targeted frame.

getStackTrace()
Return the current stack trace above this routine as a string.

methodName 
 protected String methodName
The name of the method running in the targeted frame. It is partly qualified, consisting of the last element of the classname plus the method name (for example, "String.indexOf").

className 
 protected String className
The name of the class that method belongs to. Fully qualified.

fileName 
 protected String fileName
The file that method is in. The full pathname is not available.

lineNumber 
 protected String lineNumber
The line number the trace call is on.

getStackTrace 
 public static String getStackTrace()
Return the current stack trace above this routine as a string. Deprecated.
